description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/4175396574 at Tue Apr 25 13:55:14 UTC 2023

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: kas Service Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="kas"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="kas"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="kas"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="kas"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="kas"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="kas"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="kas"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="kas"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="kas"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: kas Service Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="kas"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="kas"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="kas"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="kas"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="kas"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="kas"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="kas"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="kas"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="kas"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: kas Service RPS - Requests per Second

    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="grpc_requests",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="kas"}),

  or

    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_5m{component="grpc_requests",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="kas"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="grpc_requests",monitor="global",type="kas"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""

  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="grpc_requests",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="kas"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="grpc_requests",monitor="global",type="kas"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""

  or

    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_30m{component="grpc_requests",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="kas"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="grpc_requests",monitor="global",type="kas"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""

    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_6h{component="grpc_requests",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="kas"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="grpc_requests",monitor="global",type="kas"})))),

panels.content:
### Observability Tools

* [üêû Sentry Releases: gitlab/kas](https://sentry.gitlab.net/gitlab/kas/releases?environment=${environment})
* [üêû Sentry issues](https://sentry.gitlab.net/gitlab/kas/issues?environment=${environment})
* [üìñ Kibana: Kubernetes Agent Server logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.msg,json.project_id,json.commit_id,json.number_of_files,json.grpc.time_ms),filters:!((meta:(key:json.type.keyword,params:kas,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type.keyword:(query:kas,type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.stage,params:'$stage',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type,params:kas,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:kas,type:phrase))))),index:'78f49290-709e-11eb-b821-df2c3b5b1510')&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìñ Kibana: Kubernetes Agent Server failed request logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.msg,json.project_id,json.commit_id,json.number_of_files,json.grpc.time_ms),filters:!((meta:(key:json.type.keyword,params:kas,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type.keyword:(query:kas,type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.stage,params:'$stage',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type,params:kas,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:kas,type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:exists,type:json.error,value:exists),query:(exists:(field:json.error)))),index:'78f49290-709e-11eb-b821-df2c3b5b1510')&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìà Kibana: Kubernetes Agent Server requests](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=78f49290-709e-11eb-b821-df2c3b5b1510&_a=(filters:!((meta:(key:json.type.keyword,params:kas,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type.keyword:(query:kas,type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.stage,params:'$stage',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type,params:kas,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:kas,type:phrase))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(),schema:metric,type:count),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìà Kibana: Kubernetes Agent Server failed requests](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=78f49290-709e-11eb-b821-df2c3b5b1510&_a=(filters:!((meta:(key:json.type.keyword,params:kas,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type.keyword:(query:kas,type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.stage,params:'$stage',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type,params:kas,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:kas,type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:exists,type:json.error,value:exists),query:(exists:(field:json.error)))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(),schema:metric,type:count),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))

Apdex attribution for grpc_requests Latency - per grpc_method

panels.description:
Kubernetes containers are allocated a share of CPU. When this is exhausted, the container may be thottled.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, pod, container) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard, pod, container) (
        rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="kas"}[5m])
      )
      /
      sum by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, pod, container) (
        container_spec_cpu_quota:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="kas"}
        /
        container_spec_cpu_period:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="kas"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_cpu component saturation: Kube Container CPU Utilization

panels.description:
This uses the working set size from cAdvisor for the cgroup's memory usage. That may
not be a good measure as it includes filesystem cache pages that are not necessarily
attributable to the application inside the cgroup, and are permitted to be evicted
instead of being OOM killed.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      container_memory_working_set_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="kas"}
      /
      (container_spec_memory_limit_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="kas"} > 0)
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_memory component saturation: Kube Container Memory Utilization

panels.description:
Measures Go memory usage as a percentage of container memory limit
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(env, environment, tier, type, stage, shard, cluster, pod) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      go_memstats_alloc_bytes{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="kas"}
      / on(env, environment, tier, type, stage, shard, cluster, pod) group_left()
      topk by(env, environment, tier, type, stage, shard, cluster, pod) (1,
        container_spec_memory_limit_bytes:labeled{container=~"gitlab-pages|gitlab-workhorse|kas|registry|thanos-store",env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="kas"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_go_memory component saturation: Go Memory Utilization per Node

panels.description:
The [Horizontal Pod Autoscaler](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/run-application/horizontal-pod-autoscale/)
automatically scales the number of Pods in a deployment based on metrics.

The Horizontal Pod Autoscaler has a configured upper maximum. When this
limit is reached, the HPA will not increase the number of pods and other
resource saturation (eg, CPU, memory) may occur.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, horizontalpodautoscaler, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_status_desired_replicas:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="kas", shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|urgent-authorized-projects|urgent-other", namespace!~"pubsubbeat"}
      /
      kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_spec_max_replicas:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="kas", shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|urgent-authorized-projects|urgent-other", namespace!~"pubsubbeat"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_desired_replicas component saturation: Horizontal Pod Autoscaler Desired Replicas

panels.description:
Open file descriptor utilization per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor utilization per instance
Number of connected agents and agentk Pods

title: kas: Overview
